instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1425: What is A1425? A1425 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Early 2013, Late 2012 with EMC 2672, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3190, 820-3462..
definitions.820-3462: What is 820-3462? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: Macbook Pro 13 (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>) <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Kernel panic
threads.message: Hi macbook turn on but issue with kernel panic ,try to mount USB with [B]ASD 3S155 [/B]but getting kernel messages also its very hot around <CHIP>U3600</CHIP> ,will upload the image of kernel panic screen

threads.title: Macbook Pro 13 (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>) <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Kernel panic
Macbook Pro 13 (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>) <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Kernel panic
Macbook Pro 13 (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>) <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Kernel panic
threads.message: If <CHIP>U3600</CHIP> gets burning hot it may be fucked, they normally get a little warm but not finger burning. There is not much to loose with a kernel panic board so if in doubt pull <CHIP>U3600</CHIP> off and see if it works again. Thunderbolt we can live without!

threads.title: Macbook Pro 13 (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>) <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Kernel panic
threads.message: I found that <SIGNAL>PP15V_TBT</SIGNAL> short try to remove <CHIP>U9610</CHIP> and <CHIP>U9410</CHIP> and <CHIP>U3890</CHIP> still same

threads.title: Macbook Pro 13 (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>) <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Kernel panic
threads.message: Why are you not removing <CHIP>U3600</CHIP>? Just remove <TRANSISTOR>Q3880</TRANSISTOR> to isolate any TBT current leak. TBT is never going to work again anyway.

threads.title: Macbook Pro 13 (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>) <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Kernel panic
threads.message: remove <TRANSISTOR>Q3880</TRANSISTOR> still when loading on the half showing forbidden sign

threads.title: Macbook Pro 13 (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>) <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Kernel panic
threads.message: I ask again why are you not removing <CHIP>U3600</CHIP>! You said it was getting burning hot! Also forbidden sign is usually just a corrupted OSX.

threads.title: Macbook Pro 13 (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>) <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Kernel panic
threads.message: <CHIP>U3600</CHIP> Removed and still same ,fan spin loud and stuck on half load the USB with ASD 3S155

threads.title: Macbook Pro 13 (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>) <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Kernel panic
threads.message: I am really out of ideas on this one. There was obviously a voltage spike on the thunderbolt and this could have damaged pretty much everything. Also removing the TBT stuff should not cause the fan to run high so I have no idea what happened there. You booting EFI version of ASD?

threads.title: Macbook Pro 13 (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>) <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Kernel panic
threads.message: Kernel panic TLB validation dpi timeout
